channel.title: Funky Client Problem
channel.description: Ok, iv narrowed my problem down to this. I extracted a fresh copy of "web client ready.rar" from the source HybridPvP V3. And I extracted it and all I did was creat a jar of it. I dident edit anything, or compie anything. Now I took that jar and tried it on 3 different computers. Mine and it worked, another with windows xp and it worked, and finally 1 with windows 7 and it worked. Then since all 3 tests worked I DID NOT EDIT ANYTING, I just opened the source of the client and compiled. I got no errors what soever, and remember I DID NOT EDIT ANYTHING i just compiled for the hell of it. evything worked. Then when I went to test on all 3 computers again. It worked on mine, but on the other 2 I got this error while running the client.jar. "Could not find the main class: client" Program will now close. What the hell is going on.

item.title: Funky Client Problem
item.dc:creator: @cowin234 cowin234
item.description:
@cowin234 wrote:

Ok, iv narrowed my problem down to this. I extracted a fresh copy of “web client ready.rar” from the source HybridPvP V3. And I extracted it and all I did was creat a jar of it. I dident edit anything, or compie anything. Now I took that jar and tried it on 3 different computers. Mine and it worked, another with windows xp and it worked, and finally 1 with windows 7 and it worked. Then since all 3 tests worked I DID NOT EDIT ANYTING, I just opened the source of the client and compiled. I got no errors what soever, and remember I DID NOT EDIT ANYTHING i just compiled for the hell of it. evything worked. Then when I went to test on all 3 computers again. It worked on mine, but on the other 2 I got this error while running the client.jar. “Could not find the main class: client” Program will now close. What the hell is going on.

Read full topic
